title: Sheridan Smith shares 'glowing' meme after pregnancy 'confirmation'
text:
Sheridan Smith shares ‘glowing’ meme (Picture: Instagram / @sheridansmithster)

Sheridan Smith appears to have confirmed her pregnancy through the form of a meme – and we love her for it.

After weeks of speculation, since the 38-year-old reportedly told her fans she had a ‘baby on board’ when performing on a cruise, it seems she has finally put all rumours to bed.

Taking to Instagram, the star shared a picture of an orangutan looking all glum, with the caption: ‘I was told there would be glowing.’

She then followed this with a selfie in her stories, where she wrote: ‘Hormones got me like…’

Fans were quick to rush to the comments and started to congratulate the actress on her apparent baby news.

‘Wonderful news congratulations!!!’ one wrote while another teased: ‘I never glowed xx 18 years after my first child was born and 2 children after him..I’m still patiently waiting.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Someone else laughed: ‘My glow was perspiration from the effort it took to walk.’

This isn’t the first time the singer has hinted at being pregnant, as she recently complained about a spell of ‘morning sickness’, which led to fans questioning whether or not she is expecting a baby.

Taking to Instagram, Sheridan shared a picture of her VIP passes for the musical theatre cruise Stages 2019.

She seemingly confirmed her baby news (Picture: Instagram / @sheridansmithster)

Here she wrote: ‘About to set sail for four days, wish me luck with my morning sickness.’

Sheridan also referred to her fiance, Jamie Horn, as ‘daddy cool’ in a video she shared to her Instagram story, as the two hung out in their cabin.

The star has previously revealed that she would love to become a parent alongside her partner, after recently working with children during a production of Joseph And The Technicolour Dreamcoat.

‘I can’t tell you how much I love the kids,’ she told The Mirror. ‘I am gonna miss them so much. They are all an utter joy and have made the whole experience for me.

‘I wish cherish the memories and watch their careers flourish. Me and Jamie are now thinking of making me a mamma. All thanks to these amazing souls.’

Metro.co.uk have reached out to Sheridan’s reps for further comment.
